Detailed Description

Author:
Michael Betancourt, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
Implementation of a Bayesian approach to the comparison of two histograms, providing the results from both model comparison as well as a mixture model. Both approaches admit histograms generated from independent events as well as importance samping, allowing for the comparison of histograms generated from data or simulation.

Note that the algorithms accept one, two, and three dimensional histograms.

Examples:

main.cpp.

TString  imageName

Compute the probability of same source and mixture model posterior for the two input histograms, summarizing the results with an output image.
